summary: The diff adds a new landing-page-style React app with navy/saffron theming and basic SEO tags in index.html, but it does not provide the required generated hero/image assets and (from the truncated App.tsx) there is insufficient evidence that the hero CTAs and hero artwork requirements are met. It also introduces Internet Identity/auth hooks that are explicitly out of scope.

missing_requirements.requirement: Hero section must include a visual featuring an India map outline and four exam-prep icons (book, target, globe, chart) as part of the hero visual, plus CTA buttons labeled exactly "Start Practice" and "Download Free PDFs" with hover/focus styles.
missing_requirements.reason: App.tsx is truncated and the visible code only shows use of Lucide icons; there is no clear evidence of an India map outline visual or the exact CTA labels being rendered in the hero.

missing_requirements.requirement: Ensure there is a single H1 on the homepage; use semantic landmarks/structure and accessible alt text for meaningful images.
missing_requirements.reason: While index.html includes title/meta description, App.tsx is truncated so there is not enough evidence to confirm exactly one H1 on the homepage and correct alt-text handling for hero/meaningful images.

missing_requirements.requirement: Include generated hero artwork as static assets under frontend/public/assets/generated and use it in the hero section without backend fetching.
missing_requirements.reason: No files under frontend/public/assets/generated are shown as added, and the hero implementation shown uses Lucide React icons rather than referenced generated static image assets.

hallucinated_features.description: Internet Identity authentication/context hooks and actor/React Query integration (login/identity handling) despite auth flows being explicitly out of scope (non-goal) unless requested.
hallucinated_features.reason: BuildRequest explicitly lists user accounts/authentication flows (Internet Identity) as out of scope, but the diff adds InternetIdentityProvider usage and identity-based actor creation logic.
